sen.j: 中村吉六（なかむら きちろく、昭和48年1973年11月21日 -）は、立役。
sen.e: Kichiroku NAKAMURA (November 21, 1973 -) is a Tachiyaku (alternatively, tateyaku, which is a term used in the Japanese theatrical form Kabuki to refer to a young adult male role, and to an actor who plays this role).

Kichiroku NAKAMURA (November 21, 1973 -) is a Tachiyaku (alternatively, tateyaku, which is a term used in the Japanese theatrical form Kabuki to refer to a young adult male role, and to an actor who plays this role).

Kichiroku NAKAMURA (November 21, 1973 -) is a Tachiyaku (alternatively, tateyaku, which is a term used in the Japanese theatrical form Kabuki to refer to a young adult male role, and to an actor who plays this role).

sen.j: 中村吉右衛門 (2代目)門下。
sen.e: Kichiroku studies under Kichiemon NAKAMURA (the 2nd).
Kichiroku studies under Kichiemon NAKAMURA (the 2nd).
Kichiroku studies under Kichiemon NAKAMURA (the 2nd).

sen.j: 広島市安佐南区出身の歌舞伎役者。
sen.e: Kichiroku is a Kabuki actor and is from Asa-minami Ward, Hiroshima City.
Kichiroku is a Kabuki actor and is from Asa-minami Ward, Hiroshima City.
Kichiroku is a Kabuki actor and is from Asa-minami Ward, Hiroshima City.

sen.j: 広島市立沼田高等学校卒業。
sen.e: Kichiroku graduated from Hiroshima Municipal Numata High School.
Kichiroku graduated from Hiroshima Municipal Numata High School.
Kichiroku graduated from Hiroshima Municipal Numata High School.

sen.j: 本名は 松栄忠志（まつさかただし）。
sen.e: Kichiroku's real name is Tadashi MATSUSAKA.
Kichiroku's real name is Tadashi MATSUSAKA.
Kichiroku's real name is Tadashi MATSUSAKA.
Kichiroku has type A blood (of ABO Blood Group).
sen.cmt: 原文に「血液型ABO式血液型」となっていましたのはリンク先表示によるものでしたので、wikiサイトに準じて修正のうえ訳出しました。
sen.e: Kichiroku has type A blood (of ABO Blood Group).
Kichiroku has type A blood (of ABO Blood Group).

sen.j: 趣味は献血 アウトドア キャンプ
sen.e: Kichiroku's hobbies are blood donation, outdoor activities and camping.
Kichiroku's hobbies are blood donation, outdoor activities and camping.
Kichiroku's hobbies are blood donation, outdoor activities and camping.

sen.j: 1994年国立劇場第十二期歌舞伎俳優研修修了｡
sen.e: In 1994, Kichiroku finished the Twelfth-term Kabuki Actor Training Program of the National Theatre of Japan.
sen.cmt: 国立劇場英語名称のイギリス式綴り（Theatre）は劇場公式名称によるものです。http://www.ntj.jac.go.jp/english/index.html参考：[1] http://www.accu.or.jp/ich/en/training/curriculum/second/pdf/ppt/lecture4_ppt.pdf [2] http://www.jstor.org/pss/3205749
sen.e: In 1994, Kichiroku finished the Twelfth-term Kabuki Actor Training Program of the National Theatre of Japan.
In 1994, Kichiroku finished the Twelfth-term Kabuki Actor Training Program of the National Theatre of Japan.

sen.j: 同年4月双蝶々曲輪日記 角力場の見物人ほかで初舞台。
sen.e: Kichiroku first appeared on stage in April, 1994, when he played the role of a spectator in the Sumo-ba (sumo wrestling scene) and the others of "Futatsu chocho kuruwa no nikki" (literally, A Diary of Two Butterflies in the Pleasure Quarters).

Kichiroku first appeared on stage in April, 1994, when he played the role of a spectator in the Sumo-ba (sumo wrestling scene) and the others of "Futatsu chocho kuruwa no nikki" (literally, A Diary of Two Butterflies in the Pleasure Quarters).

Kichiroku first appeared on stage in April, 1994, when he played the role of a spectator in the Sumo-ba (sumo wrestling scene) and the others of "Futatsu chocho kuruwa no nikki" (literally, A Diary of Two Butterflies in the Pleasure Quarters).

tit.e: Chronological List of the Main Events
Chronological List of the Main Events
Chronological List of the Main Events

sen.j: 1995年10月国立劇場『平家女護島』の海上の場の立廻りで国立劇場特別賞｡
sen.e: In October, 1995, Kichiroku won a Special Award of the National Theatre of Japan for his Tachimawari (stylized fight scene) performance in the scene of the sea (Kikai ga shima Island) in the play "Heike Nyogo ga shima" (literally, the Taira clan [and] the legendary island of women).
sen.cmt: 以下の参考サイトから、この作品名は通称「俊寛」であることから、国立劇場も"Heike Nyogo ga shima-Shunkan"として紹介しているようです。また、原文に「海上の場」とありますが、正確には「鬼界ヶ島」の場 the Kikai ga shima scene を指すようです。作品名参考：[1] http://www.arc.ritsumei.ac.jp/lib/mt_field/mt-search.cgi?search=nyogo+ga+shima&IncludeBlogs=32&limit=20[2] http://www.kabuki21.com/shunkan.php[3] http://dic.yahoo.co.jp/dsearch?enc=UTF-8&stype=1&dtype=0&p=%E5%A5%B3%E8%AD%B7%E3%81%8C%E5%B3%B6
sen.e: In October, 1995, Kichiroku won a Special Award of the National Theatre of Japan for his Tachimawari (stylized fight scene) performance in the scene of the sea (Kikai ga shima Island) in the play "Heike Nyogo ga shima" (literally, the Taira clan [and] the legendary island of women).

In October, 1995, Kichiroku won a Special Award of the National Theatre of Japan for his Tachimawari (stylized fight scene) performance in the scene of the sea (Kikai ga shima Island) in the play "Heike Nyogo ga shima" (literally, the Taira clan [and] the legendary island of women).

sen.j: 慶応三年十月（1867年10月～11月）頃の入隊。
sen.e: Kichiroku joined the Shinsengumi in about October or November, 1867.
sen.cmt: 原文に西暦日付を補足のうえ訳出しました。http://keisan.casio.jp/has10/SpecExec.cgi
sen.e: Kichiroku joined the Shinsengumi in about October or November, 1867.
Kichiroku joined the Shinsengumi in about October or November, 1867.

sen.j: 横倉甚五郎の鳥羽・伏見の戦いの直前の名簿に局長附として名が見える。
sen.e: Jingoro YOKOKURA's name list which was created on the eve of the Battle of Toba-Fushimi included Kichiroku's name as a Kyokucho-zuki (Probationary Member).
Jingoro YOKOKURA's name list which was created on the eve of the Battle of Toba-Fushimi included Kichiroku's name as a Kyokucho-zuki (Probationary Member).
Jingoro YOKOKURA's name list which was created on the eve of the Battle of Toba-Fushimi included Kichiroku's name as a Kyokucho-zuki (Probationary Member).

sen.j: 横倉によれば、鳥羽・伏見の戦いの際に伏見にて脱走したという。
sen.e: According to Yokokura, Kichiroku escaped from the Shinsengumi at Fushimi during the Battle of Toba-Fushimi.
According to Yokokura, Kichiroku escaped from the Shinsengumi at Fushimi during the Battle of Toba-Fushimi.
According to Yokokura, Kichiroku escaped from the Shinsengumi at Fushimi during the Battle of Toba-Fushimi.

sen.j: この件に関して島田魁も脱走としている。
sen.e: Kai SHIMADA also wrote that Kichiroku had escaped.
Kai SHIMADA also wrote that Kichiroku had escaped.

Kichiroku had never been heard of since then.
